SEARCH
Package cz.cuni.mff.java.drawing

Class ShapePen

java.lang.Object
cz.cuni.mff.java.drawing.Pen
cz.cuni.mff.java.drawing.ShapePen
Direct Known Subclasses:
CirclePen, LinePen, RectangleFillPen, RectanglePen
public abstract class ShapePen extends Pen
Abstract class representing a pen specifically designed for drawing shapes.

This class extends Pen and provides functionality for drawing geometric shapes. The specific shape to be drawn is determined by the implementation of the getShape(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2) method, which must be defined by subclasses.

The ShapePen class manages the start and end points of the shape based on mouse movements, handles the rendering of the shape on a BufferedImage, and supports optional filling of the shape.

The outline of the shape is rendered using the stroke width and main color defined in the settings field. The fill, if turned on, is done using the backgroundColor. Filling behavior can be turned on by setting the fill field to true in the constructor.

Subclasses should always have a non-parametric constructor in order to be usable by ServiceLoader.

The settings must always be set using Pen.setSettings(PenSettings) before use.

See Also:
  • Pen
  • PenSettings
  • RectanglePen
  • CirclePen
  • LinePen

  • Field Details

    • fill

      protected boolean fill
      Indicates whether the shape should be filled.

      In order to turn on the fill behavior, this field should be set to true in the constructor.

  • Constructor Details

      public ShapePen()

  • Method Details

    • getShape

      protected abstract Shape getShape(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Should return the Shape that will be drawn by this ShapePen, based on the given coordinates.

      This method must be implemented by subclasses to define the specific Shape that will be drawn. The shape should be situated between the start point (x1, y1) and the end point (x2, y2). The start point represents the coordinates where the mouse was first pressed to begin drawing, the end point represents the coordinates that the mouse was dragged to.

      Parameters:
      x1 - the x-coordinate of the start point
      y1 - the y-coordinate of the start point
      x2 - the x-coordinate of the end point
      y2 - the y-coordinate of the end point
      Returns:
      the Shape to be drawn

    • mouseDragged

      public final void mouseDragged(int x, int y, BufferedImage image)
      Handles the event when the mouse is dragged.

      This method draws a temporary version of the shape on the provided BufferedImage, spanning from the initial start point to the current mouse position. The state of the image behind the currently drawn shape is preserved and redrawn under it until the mouse is released, which finalizes the shape.

      If fill is true, the shape is filled with the background color before the outline is drawn with the main color, based on the Pen.settings.

      Overrides:
      mouseDragged in class Pen
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the mouse
      y - the y-coordinate of the mouse
      image - the BufferedImage to be drawn on
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when the ShapePen is used before providing PenSettings
      See Also:
      • PenSettings

    • mouseMoved

      public final void mouseMoved(int x, int y, BufferedImage image)
      Seals the Pen.mouseMoved(int, int, BufferedImage) method as empty, since it is not needed for shape drawing.
      Overrides:

    • mousePressed

      public final void mousePressed(int x, int y, BufferedImage image)
      Handles the event when the mouse is pressed.

      This method initializes the start point of the shape and saves the original state of the image to allow for proper rendering during dragging.

      Overrides:
      mousePressed in class Pen
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the mouse
      y - the y-coordinate of the mouse
      image - the BufferedImage to be drawn on

    • mouseReleased

      public final void mouseReleased(int x, int y, BufferedImage image)
      Handles the event when the mouse is released.

      This method finalizes the drawn shape and forgets the original state of the image, as it is not needed anymore.

      Overrides:
      mouseReleased in class Pen
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the mouse
      y - the y-coordinate of the mouse
      image - the BufferedImage to be drawn on
